moves.2... Nc6 3. Qxf7+: !! This move is not in the GK database.
moves.3... Kxf7 4. Bc4+ Ke8 5. Nf3 h6: Feeling a bit confused and defensive. I didn't want any more funny business with Ng5. ...d5 may have been better.
moves.6. O-O d6 7. d3 Bg4 8. Nbd2 Qf6 9. b4: white wasting no time clearing space for the b file by offering the pawn.
moves.9... Nxb4: I take the bait. ...d5 may have been better.
moves.10. Rb1 Bxf3 11. Nxf3 Rb8: Being 9+ I decide to give back the knight to keep my pawns intact.
moves.12. Bxg8 Rxg8 13. Rxb4 d5: ...d5 finally, to discover attack the rook.
moves.14. Rb5 dxe4 15. Rxe5+: I missed the double attack on e5.
Giving back the material to balance out the game, also threatens mate.
moves.20. Rxe5 Bxe5: Even again. I thought my postion looked good enough for a draw.
knowing that b6 would fail to protect all the pawns from Rd7+, I decide to trade rooks and leave a7 as a trap pawn.
moves.28... Bd6: to defend c7 and keep the white bishop trapped.
moves.32... Ke4 33. a4 Bxh2 34. Bc5: With no way to stop the a pawn from promoting, I resigned. Thanks for watching.
